head.p: from: jane.smith@something.de to: dearmyfriend@something.com RE: Article about black people and racism in the USA

p.s: lately I have been reading the novel The Hate U Give by Angie Thomas.
A major topic in this book is racism so I wondered wetherwhether racism really is that much of a problem.
I found this article Schwarze in den USA: Der Rassismus ist messbar in the online magazine Zeit Online written by Alexandra Endres from the 25th August 2014.
It is a little older, but I wanted to know if things are still this way.
She says that the segregation that was supposed to be over still is visible in many parts of society.
Her first point is the higher chance of black people getting arrested as they are more often stopped and get searched.
Furthermore, the education shows differences between black and white people.
Black people less often finish school, many of them quit it or hardly major with an academical qualification.
Additionally it is harder to get jobs, sometimes also if they have a good qualification but many of the black people live in poverty, more than white people.
This article really made me think and I would love to hear from you about your experiences with this issue.
In the meantime I hope you are doing fine.
